page.title: 10CATTLE BREEDERS, BROMSGROVE
page.content: {Avoncroft Cattle Breeders,}Stoke Prior Bromsgrove conducts a{cow insemination service for{3,500 farmers} in the West Midlands. Technicians operate four Centres at Hereford, Alcester, Banbury and Bromyard. At the main Centre up to {80 bulls }are kept for the collection and{freezing} in liquid nitrogen of {semen,}used both for the {national} {insemination service}and export. The {Co-Operative }set up in 1944 with a grant from the Cadbury Trust operating under Ministry of Agriculture licence, is run by a Board of Directors who farm in the area.Black and White bulls are the main breed on the stud with {Canadian Holstein }replacing{British} {Friesian}as the preferred dairy breed. The traditional {Hereford} beef breed is challenged by {Charolais} and {Limousin.}Widespread {progeny testing assists{genetic improvement}of cattle.
